pullrequest.title: Slimmed down the Plugin pull request (no more template specializations)

content.raw:
I see, so I'll have to keep that `shared_ptr` alive anyway, otherwise if I get rid of it I'll delete the underlying raw pointer. In either case, I'll have to keep hold of something. It is slightly inconvenient for GUI, because I'm giving ownership of the underlying pointer to Qt and it will take care of its lifecycle. If I keep a `shared_ptr`, I'll have to keep track of it as well.

Is there a trick you can think of for this use case? I didn't find a way to release the shared_ptr without deleting its raw pointer. Is there a chance we can have a `as_unique_ptr` or receive a raw pointer which is not deleted?
